metadata.title: CVE-2021-45483 on Ubuntu Pro FIPS-updates 22.04 LTS (jammy) - medium
metadata.description:
In WebKitGTK before 2.32.4, there is a use-after-free inWebCore::Frame::page, a different vulnerability than CVE-2021-30889.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-45483` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-javascriptcoregtk-4.0 - 2.34.0-1ubuntu1
gir1.2-webkit2-4.0 - 2.34.0-1ubuntu1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-18 - 2.34.0-1ubuntu1
libjavascriptcoregtk-4.0-bin - 2.34.0-1ubuntu1
libwebkit2gtk-4.0-37 - 2.34.0-1ubuntu1
webkit2gtk-driver - 2.34.0-1ubuntu1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: webkit2gtk package in jammy was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '2.34.0-1ubuntu1').
qtwebkit-opensource-src: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
wpewebkit: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue.
